quotes.quote: Perfume follows you; it chases you and lingers behind you. It's a reference mark. Perfume makes silence talk.
Perfume is a story in odor, sometimes a poetry in memory.
Perfume puts the finishing touch to elegance - a detail that subtly underscores the look, an invisible extra that completes a man and a woman's personality. Without it there is something missing.

The best fragrance is the scent of water, the fragrance of dew and rain falling on plants. Water is the essential element, a source of life and energy. A perfume that, like a garment, moves to suit the woman, her skin. A perfume that embraces a woman.
A perfume should be as imbued with meaning as it is light to wear.
Perfume must not be linked just to fashion because that means that one day it will go out of style.
Perfume is the indispensable complement to the personality of women, the finishing touch on a dress.
A perfume is an intimate object, it is the reflector of the heart.
Perfumes are the feelings of flowers.
Perfume is the art that makes memory speak.
The gift of perfume to a flower is a special grace like genius or like beauty, and never becomes common or cheap.
Perfume is pretty good because nobody has to hold the product by their face or use it.
Just like men, perfume is never perfect right away you have to let it seduce you.
Perfume is the key to our memories.
As perfume to the flower, so is kindness to speech.
Perfume is like a parenthesis, a moment of freedom, peace, love and sensuality in between the disturbances of modern living.
No elegance is possible without perfume. It is the unseen, unforgettable, ultimate accessory.
Many perfumes promise to lure men to women. None of them smell of motherhood. None of them proclaim the wearer to be tidy, thrifty, and sensible.
Perfume is that last and best reserve of the past, the one which when all out tears have run dry, can make us cry again!
Perfume is like cocktails without the hangover, like chocolate without the calories, like an affair without tears, like a vacation from which you never have to come back.
A perfume is like a piece of clothing, a message, a way of presenting oneself, a costume that differs according to the woman who wears it.
Wear perfume wherever you want to be kissed.
Wear perfume wherever you want to be kissed!
Don't wear perfume in the garden unless you want to be pollinated by bees.
Fragrance speaks the loudest on a subliminal level.
Anytime the perfume of orange and lemon groves wafts in the window; the human body has to feel suffused with a languorous well-being.
Fragrance, whether strong or delicate, is a highly subjective matter, and one gardener's perfume is another gardener's stink.
Perfume is a mark of female identity and the final touch of her style.
Perfume is the nourishment that stimulates my thinking.
A woman's perfume tells more about her than her handwriting.
